org.jgapcustomised

Class Species

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgapcustomised.Species

  • public class Species
extends java.lang.Object
    Species are reproductively isolated segments of a population. They are used to ensure diversity in the population. This can protect innovation, and also serve to maintain a broader search space, avoiding being trapped in local optima.
    Author:
    Philip Tucker

        public boolean containsBestPerforming

    • Constructor Detail

      • Species

        public Species(SpeciationParms aSpeciationParms,
       Chromosome aRepresentative)
        Create new specie from representative. Representative is first member of specie, and all other members of specie are determined by compatibility with representative. Even if representative dies from population, a reference is kept here to determine specie membership.
        Parameters:
        aSpeciationParms -
        aRepresentative -

        public boolean add(Chromosome aChromosome)
        Parameters:
        aChromosome -
        Returns:

        public void clear()
        Remove all chromosomes from this species. NOTE: this method does not update the species field in the removed Chromosomes.

      • cull

        public void cull(java.util.Collection<Chromosome> keepers)
        Remove all chromosomes from this specie except keepers NOTE: this method does not update the species field in the removed Chromosomes.
        Parameters:
        keepers - Collection contains chromosome objects

      • cullToElites

        public void cullToElites(Chromosome popBestPerforming)
        remove all non-elite chromosomes from this species, except for population-wide bestPerforming

      • newGeneration

        public void newGeneration()
        update internal variables (bestPerforming, stagnantGenerationsCount) to begin new generation

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        true iff specie contains no active chromosomes in population

      • getChromosomeSpeciatedFitnessValue

        public double getChromosomeSpeciatedFitnessValue(Chromosome aChromosome)
        Parameters:
        aChromosome -
        Returns:
        Adjusted fitness for aChromosome relative to this species
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if chromosome is not a member if this specie

      • getAverageFitnessValue

        public double getAverageFitnessValue()
        Returns:
        Average fitness over all chromosomes in this species. This is equivalent to the sum of calling getChromosomeSpeciatedFitnessValue(Chromosome) over all chromosomes in this species.

      • getBestPerforming

        public Chromosome getBestPerforming()
        Returns:
        Chromosome bestPerforming in this specie

      • getPreviousBestPerforming

        public Chromosome getPreviousBestPerforming()

      • setPreviousBestPerforming

        public void setPreviousBestPerforming(Chromosome previousBestPerforming)

      • getElite

        public java.util.List<Chromosome> getElite(double proportion,
                                  int minToSelect,
                                  Chromosome bestPerforming)
        Determine and return the top specified proportion of chromosomes in this species. The returned chromosomes are marked as being elite and all other chromosomes in this species are marked as not elite.
        Parameters:
        proportion - The proportion of Chromosomes to select, range (0, 1).
        minToSelect - The minimum number of Chromosomes to select. Use 0 for no minimum.
        bestPerforming - If not null this is the population-wide best performing and should be added to the list of elites.
        Returns:
        top proportion (or minToSelect, which ever is greater) of fittest Chromosomes in this species.

      • getTop

        public java.util.List<Chromosome> getTop(int numToSelect,
                                boolean includeElites)
        Parameters:
        numToSelect - The number of Chromosomes to select.
        includeElites - If true then elites will be included in the returned list, otherwise elites will be ignored.
        Returns:
        the numToSelect fittest Chromosomes in this species.

        public boolean match(Chromosome aChromosome)
        Parameters:
        aChromosome -
        Returns:
        boolean true iff compatibility difference between aChromosome
